Instance.

Member Function Documentation

- (void EC2Instance.)addBlockDeviceMapping: (EC2InstanceBlockDeviceMapping *)  blockDeviceMapping  

Adds a single object to blockDeviceMappings.

This function will alloc and init blockDeviceMappings if not already done.

- (void EC2Instance.)addProductCode: (EC2ProductCode *)  productCode  

Adds a single object to productCodes.

This function will alloc and init productCodes if not already done.

- (void EC2Instance.)addSecurityGroup: (EC2GroupIdentifier *)  securityGroup  

Adds a single object to securityGroups.

This function will alloc and init securityGroups if not already done.

- (void EC2Instance.)addTag: (EC2Tag *)  tag  

Adds a single object to tags.

This function will alloc and init tags if not already done.

- (NSString * EC2Instance.)description  

Returns a string representation of this object; useful for testing and debugging.

Returns:
A string representation of this object.
- (id EC2Instance.)init  

Default constructor for a new object.

Callers should use the property methods to initialize this object after creating it.

Property Documentation

- (NSString *) instanceType [read, write, retain]

The instance type.

For more information on instance types, please see the <a "http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AWSEC2/2009-07-15/DeveloperGuide/"> Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud Developer Guide.

Constraints:
Allowed Values: t1.micro, m1.small, m1.large, m1.xlarge, m2.xlarge, m2.2xlarge, m2.4xlarge, c1.medium, c1.xlarge, cc1.4xlarge, cg1.4xlarge

- (NSString *) privateDnsName [read, write, retain]

The private DNS name assigned to the instance.

This DNS name can only be used inside the Amazon EC2 network. This element remains empty until the instance enters a running state.

- (NSString *) publicDnsName [read, write, retain]

The public DNS name assigned to the instance.

This DNS name is contactable from outside the Amazon EC2 network. This element remains empty until the instance enters a running state.

- (NSString *) rootDeviceType [read, write, retain]

The root device type used by the AMI.

The AMI can use an Amazon EBS or instance store root device.

- (NSString *) stateTransitionReason [read, write, retain]

Reason for the most recent state transition.

This might be an empty string.
